This is due to their mechanism of disrupting protein synthesis, leading to cell death, with outer hair cells being more vulnerable. The retrieved evidence paths support this by indicating interactions between aminoglycosides and genes associated with outer hair cells. Therefore, the most affected area by aminoglycosides is the outer hair cells in the basal area.
